==Events==
*[[1180]] &ndash; [[Battle of Uji (1180)|First Battle of Uji]], starting the [[Genpei War]] in [[Japan]].
*[[1280]] &ndash; The [[Battle of Moclín (1280)|Battle of Moclín]] takes place in the context of the [[Spanish Reconquista]] pitting the forces of the [[Kingdom of Castile]] against the [[Emirate of Granada]]. The battle resulted in a Granadian victory.
*[[1305]] &ndash; A peace treaty between the [[Flanders|Flemish]] and the [[France|French]] is signed at [[Treaty of Athis-sur-Orge|Athis-sur-Orge]].
*[[1314]] &ndash; [[First War of Scottish Independence]]: The [[Battle of Bannockburn]] (south of [[Stirling]]) begins.
*[[1532]] &ndash; [[Henry VIII of England|Henry VIII]] and [[Francis I of France|François I]] sign a secret treaty against Emperor [[Charles V, Holy Roman Emperor|Charles V]].
*[[1565]] &ndash; [[Turgut Reis]] (Dragut), commander of the [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] navy, dies during the [[Siege of Malta (1565)|Siege of Malta]].
*[[1611]] &ndash; The mutinous crew of [[Henry Hudson]]'s fourth voyage sets Henry, his son and seven loyal crew members adrift in an open boat in what is now [[Hudson Bay]]; they are never heard from again.
*[[1661]] &ndash; Marriage contract between [[Charles II of England]] and [[Catherine of Braganza]].
*[[1683]] &ndash; [[William Penn]] signs a friendship treaty with [[Lenni Lenape]] Indians in [[Pennsylvania]].
*[[1713]] &ndash; The French residents of [[Acadia]] are given one year to declare allegiance to Britain or leave [[Nova Scotia]], [[Canada]].
*[[1757]] &ndash; [[Battle of Plassey]]: Three thousand [[Kingdom of Great Britain|British]] troops under [[Robert Clive]] defeat a 50,000 strong [[India]]n army under [[Siraj Ud Daulah]] at [[Plassey]].
*[[1758]] &ndash; [[Seven Years' War]]: [[Battle of Krefeld]] &ndash; British forces defeat French troops at [[Krefeld]] in [[Germany]].
*[[1760]] &ndash; Seven Years' War: [[Battle of Landeshut (1760)|Battle of Landeshut]] &ndash; [[Austria]] defeats [[Prussia]].
*[[1780]] &ndash; [[American Revolution]]: [[Battle of Springfield (Revolutionary War)|Battle of Springfield]] fought in and around [[Springfield Township, Union County, New Jersey|Springfield]], New Jersey (including [[Short Hills]], formerly of Springfield, now of [[Millburn, New Jersey|Millburn]] Township).
*[[1794]] &ndash; Empress [[Catherine the Great|Catherine II]] of [[Russia]] grants [[Jew]]s permission to settle in [[Kiev]].
*[[1810]] &ndash; [[John Jacob Astor]] forms the [[Pacific Fur Company]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[War of 1812]]: Great Britain revokes the restrictions on [[United States|American]] commerce, thus eliminating one of the chief reasons for going to war.
*[[1848]] &ndash; Beginning of the [[June Days Uprising]] in [[Paris]], [[France]].
*[[1860]] &ndash; The [[Congress of the United States|United States Congress]] establishes the [[Government Printing Office]].
*[[1865]] &ndash; [[American Civil War]]: at [[Fort Towson]] in the [[Oklahoma Territory]], [[Confederate States of America|Confederate]], [[Brigadier General (CSA)#Brigadier general|Brigadier General]] [[Stand Watie]] surrenders the last significant rebel army.
*[[1868]] &ndash; [[Typewriter]]: [[Christopher Latham Sholes]] received a patent for an invention he called the "Type-Writer."
*[[1887]] &ndash; The [[Rocky Mountains Park Act]] becomes law in [[Canada]] creating the nation's first [[national park]], [[Banff National Park]].
*[[1894]] &ndash; The [[International Olympic Committee]] is founded at the [[University of Paris|Sorbonne]] in [[Paris]], at the initiative of Baron [[Pierre de Coubertin]].
*[[1913]] &ndash; [[Second Balkan War]]: The [[Greece|Greeks]] defeat the [[Bulgaria]]ns in the [[Battle of Doiran (1913)|Battle of Doiran]].
*[[1914]] &ndash; [[Mexican Revolution]]: [[Pancho Villa]] takes [[Zacatecas]] from [[Victoriano Huerta]].
*[[1917]] &ndash; In a game against the [[Texas Rangers (baseball)|Washington Senators]], [[Boston Red Sox]] pitcher [[Ernie Shore]] retires 26 batters in a row after replacing [[Babe Ruth]], who had been ejected for punching the [[Umpire (baseball)|umpire]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Estonian War of Independence]]: the decisive defeat of the ''[[Baltische Landeswehr]]'' in the [[Battle of Cesis (1919)|Battle of Cesis]]. This day is celebrated as [[Victory Day]] in [[Estonia]].
*[[1926]] &ndash; The [[College Board]] administers the first [[SAT]] exam.
*[[1931]] &ndash; [[Wiley Post]] and [[Harold Gatty]] take off from [[Roosevelt Field, Long Island]] in an attempt to [[circumnavigate]] the world in a single-engine plane.
*[[1938]] &ndash; The [[Civil Aeronautics Act]] is signed into law, forming the [[Civil Aeronautics Authority]] in the [[United States]].
*[[1940]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: [[Nazi Germany|German]] leader [[Adolf Hitler]] surveys newly defeated Paris in now occupied France.
*[[1941]] &ndash; The [[Lithuanian Activist Front]] declares [[June Uprising in Lithuania|independence]] from the [[Soviet Union]] and forms the [[Provisional Government of Lithuania]]; it lasts only briefly as the [[Occupation of Lithuania by Nazi Germany|Nazis will occupy Lithuania]] a few weeks later.
*[[1942]] &ndash; World War II: The first selections for the [[gas chamber]] at [[Auschwitz]] take place on a train full of Jews from Paris.
*  1942   &ndash; World War II: Germany's latest [[fighter aircraft|fighter]], a [[Focke-Wulf Fw 190]], is captured intact when it [[Armin Faber|mistakenly lands]] at [[RAF Pembrey]] in [[Wales]].
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: The [[United Kingdom|British]] destroyers {{HMS|Eclipse|H08|6}} and {{HMS|Laforey|G99|6}} sink the [[Italy|Italian]] [[submarine]] [[600-Serie Adua class submarine|''Ascianghi'']] in the [[Mediterranean]] after she torpedoes the cruiser {{HMS|Newfoundland|59|6}}.
*[[1946]] &ndash; The [[1946 Vancouver Island earthquake]] strikes [[Vancouver Island]], British Columbia, Canada.
*  1946   &ndash; The [[National Democratic Front (French India)|National Democratic Front]] wins a landslide victory in the [[French India municipal election, 1946|municipal elections in French India]].
*[[1947]] &ndash; The [[United States Senate]] follows the [[United States House of Representatives]] in overriding U.S. President [[Harry Truman]]'s [[veto]] of the [[Taft-Hartley Act]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; The [[French National Assembly]] takes the first step in creating the [[French Community]] by passing the [[Loi Cadre]], transferring a number of powers from Paris to elected territorial governments in [[French West Africa]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; The [[Dutch Reformed Church]] accepts women ministers.
*[[1959]] &ndash; Convicted [[Manhattan Project]] spy [[Klaus Fuchs]] is released after only nine years in prison and allowed to emigrate to [[Dresden]], [[East Germany]] where he resumes a scientific career.
*  1959   &ndash; A fire in a resort hotel in [[Stalheim]] ([[Norway]]) kills 34 people.
*[[1960]] &ndash; The United States [[Food and Drug Administration]] declares [[Mestranol/norethynodrel|Enovid]] to be the first officially approved [[combined oral contraceptive pill]] in the world.
*[[1961]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: the [[Antarctic Treaty]], which sets aside [[Antarctica]] as a scientific preserve and bans military activity on the [[continent]], comes into force after the opening date for signature set for the December 1, 1959.
*[[1967]] &ndash; Cold War: U.S. President [[Lyndon B. Johnson]] meets with Soviet Premier [[Alexei Kosygin]] in [[Glassboro, New Jersey]] for the three-day [[Glassboro Summit Conference]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Warren E. Burger]] is sworn in as Chief Justice of the [[Supreme Court of the United States|United States Supreme Court]] by retiring Chief Justice [[Earl Warren]].
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Software Industry]] IBM announced that effective January 1970 it would price its software and services separately from hardware thus creating the modern software industry.
*[[1972]] &ndash; [[Watergate Scandal]]: U.S. President [[Richard M. Nixon]] and [[White House]] Chief of Staff [[H. R. Haldeman]] are taped talking about using the [[Central Intelligence Agency]] to obstruct the [[Federal Bureau of Investigation]]'s investigation into the [[Watergate scandal|Watergate]] break-ins.
*  1972   &ndash; [[Title IX]] of the United States [[Civil Rights Act of 1964]] is amended to prohibit [[sexism|sexual discrimination]] to any educational program receiving [[federal government of the United States|federal]] funds.
*[[1973]] &ndash; A [[fire]] at a house in [[Kingston upon Hull|Hull]], [[England]] which kills a six year old boy is passed off as an accident; it later emerges as the first of 26 deaths by fire caused over the next seven years by arsonist [[Bruce George Peter Lee|Peter Dinsdale]].
*[[1982]] &ndash; [[Chinese American]] [[Vincent Chin]] dies in a coma after being beaten in [[Highland Park, Michigan]] on June 19, by two auto workers who had mistaken him for [[Japanese people|Japanese]] and who were angry about the success of Japanese auto companies.
*[[1985]] &ndash; A terrorist bomb aboard [[Air India Flight 182]] brings the [[Boeing 747]] down off the coast of [[Ireland]] killing all 329 aboard.
*[[2012]] &ndash; [[Ashton Eaton]] breaks the [[Decathlon world record progression|decathlon world record]] at the [[2012 United States Olympic Trials (track and field)|United States Olympic Trials]].
*[[2013]] &ndash; [[Nik Wallenda]] becomes the first man to [[Skywire Live|successfully walk across]] the [[Grand Canyon]] on a [[Tightrope walking|tight rope]].
